{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2011}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox Radio station |image =| |name = ABC North Coast| |callsign = 2NR| |coordinates = {{Coord|28|48|09.32|S|153|17|31.10|E|type:landmark_scale:2000_region:AU}} |airdate = 17 July 1936 | |frequency = 738 [[Kilohertz|kHz]] [[amplitude modulation|AM]] Grafton and south
720 [[Kilohertz|kHz]] [[amplitude modulation|AM]] Tweed Valley
94.5 [[Megahertz|mHz]] [[frequency modulation|FM]] Lismore and Northern Rivers| |area = [[Northern Rivers]]| |owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | |format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | |website = [http://www.abc.net.au/northcoast/ http://www.abc.net.au/northcoast/]|}} '''ABC North Coast''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Lismore, New South Wales|Lismore]] and broadcasting to the [[Northern Rivers]] region in [[New South Wales]]. This includes the towns and cities of [[Grafton, New South Wales|Grafton]], [[Ballina, New South Wales|Ballina]], [[Casino, New South Wales|Casino]] and [[Murwillumbah, New South Wales|Murwillumbah]]. The station began as '''2NR''' in 1936 originally based in [[Grafton, New South Wales|Grafton]], moving to Lismore in 1989. It is heard on these main [[AM Broadcasting|AM]] and [[FM Broadcasting|FM]] frequencies: *'''2NR''' 738 AM *'''2ML''' 720 AM *'''2NNR''' 94.5 FM ==Local Programs== ===Weekdays=== *Breakfast with Graeme Stuart â 6:00 AM to 7:45 AM *Mornings with Vikki Kerrigan â 8:30 AM to 11:00 AM ===Saturday=== *Weekend Breakfast with Graeme Stuart â 6:00 AM to 7:45 AM and 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM When local programs are not broadcast the station is a relay of [[702 ABC Sydney]]. ==References== {{cite web |title=The history behind ABC North Coast |url= http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2008/03/01/2183425.htm |date=2003-03-01 |accessdate=2008-06-05 |publisher=[[ABC Online]] }} ==See also== * [[List of Australian radio stations]] {{ABC Local Radio}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abc North Coast}} [[Category:Radio stations in New South Wales]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1936]]
